required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Linagliptin in Elderly Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Randomised, Double Blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group, Efficacy and Safety Study of Linagliptin (5 mg) Administered Orally Once Daily Over 24 Weeks in Type 2 Diabetic Patients (Age >= 70 Years) With Insufficient Glycaemic Control( HbA1c >= 7.0) Despite Metformin and/or Sulphonylurea and/or Insulin Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of the current study is to investigate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of linagliptin (5 mg / once daily) compared to placebo given for 24 weeks as add-on therapy to stable treatment in elderly patients with T2DM with insufficient glycaemic control

primary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 24
primary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Means are treatment adjusted for baseline HbA1c and prior use of insulin.

secondary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 6 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Means are treatment adjusted for baseline HbA1c and prior use of insulin.

secondary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 12 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Means are treatment adjusted for baseline HbA1c and prior use of insulin.

secondary_outcome.measure: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 18 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Means are treatment adjusted for baseline HbA1c and prior use of insulin.

secondary_outcome.measure: FPG Change From Baseline to Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: This change from baseline reflects the Week 24 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Means are treatment-adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG and prior use of insulin.

secondary_outcome.measure: FPG Change From Baseline to Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: This change from baseline reflects the Week 6 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Means are treatment-adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG and prior use of insulin, week repeated within patient and week by treatment interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: FPG Change From Baseline to Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: This change from baseline reflects the Week 12 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Means are treatment-adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG and prior use of insulin, week repeated within patient and week by treatment interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: FPG Change From Baseline to Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: This change from baseline reflects the Week 18 FPG minus the baseline FPG. Means are treatment-adjusted for baseline HbA1c, baseline FPG and prior use of insulin, week repeated within patient and week by treatment interaction.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c <7.0% at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients with an HbA1c value below 7% at week 24 was calculated for each treatment arm. If a patient did not have an HbA1c value at week 24 they were considered a failure, so HbA1c above 7%. Only patients with baseline HbA1c >= 7%

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c <7.0% at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients with an HbA1c value below 7% at week 24 were calculated for each treatment arm. If a patient did not have an HbA1c value at week 24 they were considered a failure, so HbA1c above 7%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Have a HbA1c Lowering by at Least 0.5% at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients with an HbA1c reduction of ≥0.5% at week 24 from baseline was calculated for each treatment arm. If a patient did not have an HbA1c value at week 24 they were considered a failure, so HbA1c reduction less than 0.5%

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Rescue Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: The use of rescue therapy was planned for patients failing to achieve preset criteria based on glucose levels during the randomised treatment period of the trial

arm_group.description: patients receive linagliptin 5 mg tablets once daily
patients receive placebo tablets matching linagliptin 5 mg once daily

intervention.description: patients receive linagliptin 5 mg tablets once daily
patients receive placebo matching linagliptin 5 mg once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
1. Type 2 diabetes mellitus
2. HbA1c >= 7.0%
3. Age >= 70 years
4. Signed and dated written informed consent
Exclusion criteria:
1. Myocardial infarction, stroke or TIA within 3 months prior to informed consent
2. Impaired hepatic function
3. Treatment with glitazones, GLP-1 analogues, DPP-4 inhibitors or rapid acting or pre-mixed insulins
4. Treatment with anti-obesity drugs

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 241 patients were randomised in a 2:1 ratio to receive treatment with linagliptin 5mg (n=162) or placebo (n=79). All randomised patients were treated.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo

group.title: Linagliptin 5 mg
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with Linagliptin 5mg

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with matching placebo

group.title: Linagliptin 5 mg
group.description: Patients randomized to receive treatment with Linagliptin 5mg

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Glycosylated Hemoglobin A1 (HbA1c)
measure.description: Based upon the full analysis set (FAS) with 78 and 160 patients

measure.title: Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG)
measure.description: Based upon the FAS with 78 and 160 patients

outcome.title: HbA1c Change From Baseline to Week 24
outcome.description: HbA1c is measured as a percentage. Thus, this change from baseline reflects the Week 24 HbA1c percent minus the baseline HbA1c percent. Means are treatment adjusted for baseline HbA1c and prior use of insulin.
outcome.population: FAS consisting of all randomised patients who were treated with at least one dose of study drug, had a baseline, and at least 1 on-treatment HbA1c measurement. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used as the imputation rule.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With HbA1c <7.0% at Week 24
outcome.description: The percentage of patients with an HbA1c value below 7% at week 24 was calculated for each treatment arm. If a patient did not have an HbA1c value at week 24 they were considered a failure, so HbA1c above 7%. Only patients with baseline HbA1c >= 7%
outcome.population: FAS with baseline HbA1c >=7% and non-completers considered as failure imputation (NCF)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
